text: Flasche (33 cl) von Cheers in Peking. - Tief goldgelb, fast schon orangefarben, schwach trüb, prächtiger Schaum. - In der Nase üppiger, mit Melone und Mango angedickter harziger Hopfen. - Im Antrunk kräftige pampelmusige Hopfenherbe, Harz und Gras. Von kerniger Herbe überlagertes breites Malz. Mild rezent, vollmundig (14,5° P!). Im Abgang kernige Hopfenherbe, Pampelmuse, Nadelwald, dennoch rund. - Sehr fülliges Lager mit kernigem amerikanischem Hopfen, kein typisches Pilsner aber für sich genommen sehr überzeugend.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Tap at the Mikkeller Bar in Berlin as "Mikkeller Mitte Pils" (Might not be this, but others seem to rate this here). Pours a bit hazy orange. Nose is very fruity, watermelon, apricot, orange, blood orange. Palate is Bitter and fruity, some grains in the back. Great modern Pils.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Tap at Mikkeller Berlin as Mitte Pils (I think its the same, also 5.6% - Mitte is the neighborhood they are based in Berlin). Floral, fruity, nice and fresh. could be better if it were a bit more bitter though. nice to have mikkeller here anyway.

0.33 l bottle from Svijet piva (World of Beer), Zagreb. Shared with Vinja 666 and Nikola. Murky dark golden, small off-white head, not very pilsener-like. Floral aroma, light fruity, maybe red berries. Light to medium hopped. Light bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation. Quite full mouthfeel with a light hoppy finish. Not very pilsener-ish but good!

Keg at Mikkeller Vik. It pours lightly hazy amber with a small white head. The aroma is bready, cereal, toasted grain, grass, herbal, mild sweetness and a touch of lemon parfait. The taste is crisp, mellow grassy bitterness, toasted grain, cereal, light spice, earth, bread and some metal with a dry, spicy finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Play for what it is, but not my fav pils.
330ml bottle. Clear orange with a decent white head. Fruity aroma, flavour is initially malty finishing with a pine. Good

330ml Bottle . Cantillon tumbler . Easy to slam without too much contemplating . Nice rich malty pils , tad bready , a fruity peach undercard lingers . This would be good shit on a warm summer morning .
Draft at CBC - pours gold white head - nose/taste of pine, lemon, peppercorn - medium body

Bottle from boxbeers.dk. Pours amber coloured with an medium sized white head. Hops, herbs and grassy notes mostly. Taste is similar, medium bitterness, balanced. A bit watery texture, soft carbonation. Nice drinkability and much flavour, nice!!
Copenhagen Beer Celebration: tap: pours golden with white head. Aroma is grass and grain. Taste is light grass with nice bitterness. A tad dirty. Very pleasant. Light aftertaste.

From tap at Øl & Brød, Copenhagen. Aroma is grainy malt, hay, grassy hoppy notes, with a touch of fruits. Flavour is lightly sweetish and moderate bitter. Body is medium. Very refreshing, well-hopped Pilsner.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Light hazy golden pour with a generous head. Notes of grass, hay, some honey, light syrup. Refreshing and nice!

Tolles Pils, klar. Hat auf den ersten Blick aber relativ wenig mit einem gewöhnlichen würzhopfigen Pilsener zu tun. Dafür schmeckt es zu ALEig, extrem citrushoppy und auch grasige Stachelbeerflavours spielen eine Rolle. Also alles ganz anders und ein wenig Pale Ale-lastig. 0,2/3 Euro in der MIKKELLER BAR Barcelona. Fass.
orange with medium head; aroma is quite hoppy fruity slightly citric; taste is medium sweet, fruity, with medium bitter finish

Sample from draft at mikkeller bar, poured a light hazy Amber colour with a white head. Nose of soft malts, grass, tropical fruits, citrus, light grains, floral hops. Crisp refreshing mouthfeel. Very enjoyable pilsner

33cl bottle from Beer52.com. An amber pour with a loose off-white head; aroma of fresh orange zest; lively in the mouth with an orange marmalade taste to start, then some lemon and grapefruit; followed by a clean citrusy bitter finish with some lingering chilli heat. Not exactly your average Pilsner!
Amber Cooper color, pleasant marmelade nose, well balanced mouth with hops and orange marmalade touch. Clean, fresh, very easy drinking.

Light amber colour, medium-sized white head of little bubbles. Average retention. Aroma of resin, tropical fruit, nectar. Light to medium body. Thin to oily texture. Semi-dry taste. Nectar from malts, resiness & grassiness from hops. A minimal yeast note. Medium bitter. Medium long hoppy ending. Its funny how the new world hops and dry hopping can do an APA from a Pilsner. The question is if we need a Pilsner tasting like an APA. The beer is however good.

Coppery to amber color, medium sized white had. Nicely hopped up, herbal and grassy notes. Taste is same, medium bitter, very tasty and well balanced. Watery texture, soft carbonation. Extremely drinkable and full of flavor, nice stuff. //bottle at Craft Room

from la Cave à Bières, Yeverdon - clear golden-bronze beer with a moderate foam left; flowery and grassy hoppiness; subtle carbonation; lively palate and nice bitterness; develops long and increasing grassy and flowery hoppiness; very dry
Buona pilsner dorata e croccante, amara, profumata, dissetante. Buon finale, corpo lieve, piacevole.

Vesterbro/Karasuma Pilsner 5.6%
Pouring a glowing gold with a filmy white head and a fruity floral aroma. Medium bodied with a nice round welcoming carbonation. Fruity bready crackery malts with a soft floral hoppiness.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A pale yellow light opaque beer with a big white foamy head ; good retention and lacing on my glass. A lot of fruits (citrus, litchi), herb, light resin. Note to light sweet, light to medium dry bitter refreshing. Light to medium body, thin to average texture, average carbonation, bitter fruity finish. Overall, ok ; "exotic" pilsener ; just not used to it.

Good, rich, darkish golden color--on the dark side for a pilsner. Served cold, but crisp in its own right, with a low grassy/hop quality that removed it from the German tradition here, so far as I was concerned. Drinkable, definitely! (on tap at Mikkeller, Copenhagen)

Tap at Mikkeller, Vic. Hoppy, Aroma of citrus, orange, grass and floral notes. Malty backbone. The flavors starts sweet and finish bitter, hoppy and dry. The body is medium and the texture is juciy, carbonation is soft.

At mikkeller bar
Clear, orange, white head 
Aroma of peaches, nice
Taste bitter bread, Pilsner ok.
backlog. Clear golden with a white head. When fresh this is one of the most underrated beers on the planet. Very sessionable and hoppy, fruity hoppy notes with nice fruity notes. Very good

Clear orange color with off-white head. Although my bottle is quite old, it still has a pretty intense hop aroma with floral and fruity notes. Taste follows with lots of juicy hops and moderate bitterness and clean malts. Soft body and carbonation. This beer does not feel at all like a pils, more like a session IPA. For me this is a plus, I like quite a lot that its clean, hoppy and easy drinking.

Thanks Hammertroll! Hazy gold-amber with a small white head. 
Minty herbal hoppy aroma on a solid malty subtle backbone.
Minty herbal nice tea-like taste with light peachy notes and light bitterness and a creamy soft mouthfeel. Pretty great hoppy lager.

5.6%ABV. Pilsner.

Tapped out slightly cloudy gold. 8ºSRM.

Nose is beery and rich with a thick wheaty,pale malt body. This is the aroma you expect when you are ready to dig into a pork knuckle.

Mouthfeel is carbonated and light. The palate almost disappears from you. Perfect for pork belly or a really fatty roast pork. The palate has some nice floral hops with lychees and Jambi Ayer on the palate. A very nice fiinish for a locally themed pils. Typically Mikkeller with a good rich grain bill of wheat and pale malts which come across as candy sweet but have a full sweet pale malt body.

Finish is brief with some nice fruity floral flavors wth lychee, Jambi, green mango and green papaya.

Food pairing: pork knuckle or or locally, some very properly done SIew yoke or roast pork.

Goes on Favorites List!

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Purchased at Drinks of the World - Geneva.
A: Pours a cloudy pale yellow color forming a big creamy and white head with excellent retention and lot of soapy lacings formed and left in the glass.
S: Very grainy nose. Strong notes of pale and crystal malts. Strong notes of hery and grassy hops. Hints of resin and pineapple.
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of pale and crytal malts followed by fruity notes: Watermelon and pineapple. Grassy hops notes. Medium bitterness. Resin and earthy yeasts.
M: Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Grassy and earthy aftertaste. Medium bitter finish.
O: Very good drinkability. Excellent Pilsener. Mikkeller quality once again.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus as Jægerpils. Aroma is fruity and flowery hops. Light hazy amber with white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is light+ bitter and light sweet. Medium body, oily feel, avg. carb., hoppy bitter finish.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Sentrum. Lys gylden. Middels høyt luftig skum som daler sakte og etterlater pene filigranser. Svak parfymearoma. Smaken lett tørr & metallisk. Spor av frukt etter hvert - men litt ensformig. Avslutter tørt.

Bottle. Slightly hazy medium gold, lively lasting head. Bright hoppy aroma, citrus with some floral elements. Juicy lime hop character, a little vegetal, crackery malts, bitter finish. Quite bitter actually. Great flavours, very drinkable.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Aroma is caramel, passion fruit, earthiness and slightly tart. Taste is caramel, earthiness, light funk, lemon grass and medium puckering afterwards. Appearance is a lightly hazy gold with a medium frothy head that retains quite well.
Soft aroma of flowers and grass, underwhelming. Pale in colour, clear. Frothy head. Medium bitterness, fresh and refreshing. Short. A very good Pilsner

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Fruity and hoppy.
Adjunct: Somewhat thin, orange, cloudy amber.

Keg @ Ramen to Bíiru, Copenhagen. Served in a frosted ice-cold glass with a handle. Pours clear gold with foamy white head. Smooth, moderately sweet pilsner that was absolutely delicious. In fact it surprised me how good this was.

Bottle 330 ml. Golden color. Tropical fruits aroma: mango, passion fruit, pineapple, apricot, a bit citrus. Taste: very fruity, slightly sour, a little watery, slightly bitter taste, pleasant and drinkable.

Appearance: clear pale amber with one fat finger of rocky white head, excellent retention and good lacing. (4/5) Aroma: sweet citrus, stone fruit, grass, pale malt. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium slightly oily body, moderate carbonation, off-dry bitter finish. (3/5)

Nice solid pilsener, with a hop-forward nose incorporating citrus, stone fruit, and grassy notes, with an almost vinous character. Unlike so many pilseners, the grassiness doesnt come across as limp or weedy - probably because its almost secondary to the CTZ-style tangerine and peach notes. The flavours are more traditional than e.g. To Øl Raid Beer, which for my money remains the best pils ever, but still solid and enjoyable. (14/20)

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with an average, long lasting, white head that laces nicely. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit and grass. Sweet, fruity flavour of grapefruit, peach, grass and pine with a very dry, bitter, resin finish. Medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Not a fan of pilsners but this was excellent! I really enjoyed this one.

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Clear gold with a one-finger soapy head that lingers throughout. Full on citrus nose with lemon zest, orange and grapefruit along with some grass and pepper. Good carbonation with a medium body with some light cracker notes. Peppery finish with citrus bitterness. Really solid.

Draught @ Mikkkeller, Aarhus, as Jægerpils. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, citrusly hops. Flacor is malt, yeast, grassy, citrus, lemonpeel. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 281115
Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of citrus, grass, hops, malt, floral. Taste is hoppy, citrussy, orange peel, pine, light pilsnery yeast but overall just fresh and nice!
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Golden colour with white head. Hoppy, fruity aroma. Grain, sweet, hoppy, fruity taste. Medium body.
330 ml bottle. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and hops. Medium to light body, with average carbonation. Taste is citrusy and hoppy with bitter finish. Enjoyable.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 On tap, @Mikkeller Bar, Barcelona. 13/11/2015. Color amarillo, aroma frutal, sabor frutal, lager muy lupulada.

Pours golden color, slightly haze, with foamy white head.
Visually medium carbonation. Aroma: intense hop aroma, with notes of tropical fruits, citrus, with malt aroma in the background.
Flavor: similar as aroma, high hop flavors with notes of citrus, oranges and grapefruit, with moderate medium malt flavors, which takes on biscuit and slightly on toast.
Slightly bitter dry finish. Body is medium, carbonation also, texture is soft. The same recipe as for APA, just brewed with different yeasts.

From tap. Clear golden light orange color with off white head. Malty and heavy hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, citrusy fruity. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a mostly fading foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, grassy, honey, caramel. Taste is of lemon, orange, bread. Soft carbonation, sticky oily mouthfeel.

330ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a finger of white head with decent retention settling down to leave some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus with some earthy and floral notes. Taste is a citrus and spicy hop bitterness with some strong earthy tones and a light caramel malty sweetness. Light bodied with decent carbonation. Quite an interesting brew for the style and oddly enjoyable.

Poured golden with white head. Aroma is of citrus hops. Lots of grapefruit, orange, lemon, passionfruit. Tastes quite citrussy too. Mango, grapefruit, passionfruit. Beautiful sweetness to this one. Tastes like a hoppy fruit beer, and not like a typical lager at all. If only all pilsners were like this. Fantastic beer!
Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours clear amber. Light fruity, floral, dough aroma. Flavour is biscuit, grapefruit some mild bitterness. Crisp, fresh and drinkable. Very nice for style.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 3B, adaptado). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: citric hop aroma predominant with notes of ripe mango and passionfruit. very faint grainy malt aroma. APPEARANCE: light ambar color and slightly hazy. average white moussy head with good retention and some lacing. TASTE: hop flavour dominant with notes of passion fruit and some mango. faint cereal, malty sweet flavour at the end of the tasting with a well laggered character. medium bitterness that lasts beyond a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium-low body with moderate carbonation. OVERALL: a pilsener loaded with hops that give it another dimension, tipical of other styles. Since it has a clean lager profile, the hops are prominent with just a very faint touch of malt.

Enjoyed some of a 400 mL draft of this beer in a narrow wine-type glass at the Mikkeller bar in southwest Copenhagen. The beer had a mostly clear medium-darnk amber-orange color with a small foamy white head that had shorter retention, and lighter cling and lacing. Its aroma was a citrus and floral blend with notes of pine, and was lightly herbal. The taste was somewhat sour, but mostly bitter with grainy and earthy notes, and a light herbal and fruity sweetness. The beer was somewhat creamy with average carbonation and was on the wetter side with a thin finish.

Clean copper golden, flimsy head unfortunately. English and dank American hops. Bit sharp, although you could call it crisp. Belgian golden malts and sharp carbonation do not make this super smooth, but as more cooler night starter it does fine. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
TAP at mikkeller. Pours golden with a foamy white head. Aroma of hops, malts, grape, tropical fruits, bread. Taste is pineapple hops, malts, hops again grape. Refreshing ending.
Pale clear liquid, solid white head. Aroma of american hops (simcoe). In taste low sweet, hoppy, very bitter for a pils. Very crisp, dry, drinkable.

How: Bottle Appearance: almost clear yellow, mediuml white head. Aroma: fresh oranges, grass, grapefruit, floral, mild spices. Palate: medium body, average carboantion. Wish all pilseners could be like this.

Bottle 0,33L. Courtesy of Gregor. Slightly hazy, medium yellow colour with average big, frothy, white head. Gentle aroma of toasted malts, orange, caramel. Moderate bitter, nicely hopped taste. Medium body, dry texture and lively carbonation. Very good balance. This beer is closer to APA than pilsner. I would definitly drink more pilsner, if all the pilsners would taste like this...
Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Hoppy aroma. Pours golden with large white head. Flower hoppy, some fruits, lots of bitterness. One of those great IPA-ish pilsners.
On tap at Mikkeller Stockhom. Cloudy Amber pour with an off white head. Pleasant Pils bouquet. Tight, crisp, and clean. A nice pine hop undercurrent. Well balanced with a good body and mouthfeel.

On tap.
Slightly hazy pour, small White head. 
Slightly malty Nose, clear malty taste with Grainy notes. 
Medium body, average carbonation.

Draft at Mikkeller and Friends in Reykjavik The pils poured a cloudy amber color with a small creamy head and lacing. Nice aroma of grapefruit. There was a bitterness that lingered on your tongue. The pils had a medium body with average carbonation. This pils is close to a an APA. The finish was dry,clean with bitterness that stays with you.

Day 16 of Julepakkekalender from Mikkeller. Bottled.

Aroma: A light smell of hops, and a sweet note of apples. A touch of cinammon.
Appearance: Pours a light gold colour. A touch of hazieness. Light head, that quickly dissipates.
Taste: Strong, bitter hopiness upfront that lingers. Muted notes of citrus.
Palate: Lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation. Medium body.
Overall: Very bitter for a pilsner. Quite unusual, actually. Its more akin to an IPA. Not as refreshing as Id hoped, but very interesting nevertheless.
Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, hops and straw. Bitter flavour, hops, peach and pine. Bitter hoppy finish, malty backbone.(from draught @ Mikkeller Bar Victoriagade)

Das Pils hat eine fast klare dunkel goldene Farbe und eine ordentliche weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch grasig, tropische Früchte, sehr hopfig. Geschmack kräftig malzig, sehr hopfig, bitter, grasig und floral, tropische Früchte, gutes Pils!
Bottle 33cl. Big white head. Cloudy dark pilsener color. Aroma is hops, some malt. Taste is quite bitter. American hops quite present.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow orangeish. Fresh citrus aroma, some toffee. Taste is quite bitter for a pilsner, citrus, malts.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - golden orange with a decent creamy head. 
Nose - orange, but mostly stalky vegetal, 
Taste - more vegetal, maybe green beans, but bitter and a touch of spice.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long and fairly balanced finish.
Overall - balanced but not that tasty.
Bottle at ashs. Pours hazy orange, nose is citrus and toffee, taste is dry, bitter, light toffee.
Bottle at AshtonMcCobbs. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aromas of green vegetable, pine. Taste is bitter, more vegetal notes. Very bitter finish.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy, pale orange colour and an off-white head. Fruity aroma with apricot, citrus, mowed grass, pale malt and fruity hops. The flavour has more fruity hops with grapefruit, pine, harpix and grass. Has a slick mouth feel, and a solid bitterness. A tasteful and aromatic pilsener, but I feel the hops takes too much place and maybe and the beer is a bit one dimensional.
hazy dark golden with white head.Aroma is floral, spice, citrus and green hops. Aftertaste is dry, spicy, earth and refreshing. Overall:Nice one
Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 14.1.2015. Dark gold with white film. Hoppy, piney and a little green aroma, very bitter, hoppy, just slightly milder than an IPA. Light body, citrusy finish.

33 cl bottle.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Nice floral hops on the nose, tropical fruits and mild piney, resinous sweetness. Resinous hops, caramel malts and lots of grapefruits on the flavor, slightly grassy lingering bitterness on the finish. Strong carbonation, very refreshing grape-y brew. Very nice and balanced.
3615

Wow, this is a really nice one. Looks just that way one wants a lager should look like on a hot sunny summer day, now its the middle of winter but what does it matter? Fresh, fruity taste, that bounce around in your mouth for a while. Hopped that typical Mikkeller way!
Clear deep yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grass, hops and tropical fruit. Taste is hops and mango
Clear straw yellow color with white head. Flowery aroma with some hops, perfume and caramel. Somewhat fruity taste with a light, well balanced hoppiness that lingers for some time. Good pils.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear amber pour with a big frothy white white head, malt and lemon and pine aroma, taste has a shit load of hops for a pilsner, quite resinous, has some lagery malt action but super hoppy and bitter, enjoyable Ive just gotta ignore the style allocation.
33cl bottle from cerveteca. Dark golden to orange color. Thin head. High bitterness. Low sweetness. Crispy body. Aroma is super hoppy. Damn! Its good but is this really a pilsener?

330 mml bottle tasted on the 31/12/2014. Hazy orange colour with a low white bubble head. Aroma of grain, hops and fruits. Taste of citrus, hops and yeast. Medium carbonation. Nice Pilsener. Next one please!

December 14, 2014. Bottle at home, best before august 2016.  
Hazy dark orange with a medium sized white head. Aroma is ripe papaya, citrus, caramel, grain and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet ripe tropical fruits with a light bitterness. Finish is fruity sweetness with a dry and light metallic bitterness. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.
Pours cloudy orange amber with low white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, ripe mango, slight funk. Taste is modestly bitter with a fruit sweet finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

0,33 l bottle from Mikkeller Julepakkekalender 
Very good Pilsner. 
bread, hay, cereal, grass, some citrus and herbs.
golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle from Wine Emporium 091214. If only all pilseners were this good.nlooks great when poured into the glass with a strong Amber colour, fluffy white head and some cloudiness. Flavour and aroma give you passionfruit. Nice long finish.
Cobrizo pálido con espuma blanca. Aromas florales, afrutados y malta. Cuerpo ligero, textura maltosa, con sabores lupulados nuevamente afrutados y florales. Bien.
33 cl. bottle. Pale yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and fruit.

Botella de 33 cl en el momento en el lúpulo el 28-11-2014. Color rubio algo amarillento traslucido con espuma blanca persistente. Aromas y sabores frescos con toques herbáceos y cítricos. Cuerpo medio con 5.6 vol fácil de beber y algo pastosa generando espuma, notandose cada vez mas segun va calentando. No esta mal, refrescante.

Keg at BD Shepherds Bush tap takeover. It pours a clean golden color with a small white head. Aroma is quite sweet with notes of ripe apricots and mango. Taste is mildly grainy, medium fruity with notes of citrus skin, mango, hay and wet soil. Light bodied with good carbonation. Easy drinking and refreshing, quite hoppy for the style but Im not surprised

Looks.. Straw/yellow amber, sml head.
Smells.. Floral, apricot/tropical stone fruits.
Tastes..stone fruits, floral fruits, crisp
Pilsner malts. Mikkeller did it again.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. The first thing I get from this is mango and passionfruit. Very close to my all time favourite Pils in Mikkeller El Cellar De Can Roca but not as in-your-face fruit driven. This is like a toned down version. Sweet tropical fruits with mild astringent bitterness to slowly finish it off. Tasty stuff
On tap at Salon piva 2014. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is floral hoppy, fruity. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, hoppy, malty.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Lovely, deep golden colour with an amber tint. Thin, white head. Fruity aroma with grasses, herbal hops, citrus, pale malts, orange peel, light pines and exotic notes. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus notes. Neat house beer.
Tap at Salón Piva. Golden color with white head. Aroma of malt, citrus hops. Malty taste with citrus hops. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, grains, and caramel - with a dry finish. I wouldnt exactly complain if more pilseners were like this.
Hopfiger Antrunk, frisch, geringe Süße. Grasig bitter, der Hopfen verstärkt sich. Sehr hopfiges und süffiges Pils, gelungen! 12/12/13/12//12
On tap at Mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Gold pour with a white head. Citrus and vanilla aroma. Sweetcorn and bitter citrus flavour. Refreshing.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. It pours a nice gold color with a white head. The aroma is fruity and citrusy with a bold American hop profile. The flavor is more like a dry Pale Ale than a Pils. Citrus fruit and floral hops dominate. The beer is dry, but not super clean as a good Pils should be. A good drinker though.
Poured a pale, almost pinkish brown with a fuzzy lasting head. Sweet aroma and malty flavour, finished with a touch of bitterness. Very easy to drink on a hot day.

Ok, not a huge pils guy but with mikkeller he always amazes you with his ability to know what "you" like and does it different and usually better. Light citrus and hints of apricot aroma. Crisp and clean. Good light smooth mouthfeel. Taste is hints of caramel, but all flavor of a hoppy brew that doesnt go too far. A lil hop spice in the swallow but doesnt linger and makes you keep coming back. I could drink this all day. Overall well balanced and the hop makes it interesting.
Draught. Clear golden pour with white head. Aroma has mango mango and peach. Taste is fresh with medium bitterness. A lot like a pale ale
Small hints of berries on the nose. The flavor of the nuts. Good bitterness that fills the front of the mouth for a long time. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottled from Mikkeller and friends
Deep golden with a white head. 
Light toffee and tropical fruits in the aroma. 
Toffee and salty liquorice in the flavour along with some tropical fruits. 
Medium bitterness.
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Golden with medium head. Medium bitterness and lots of hops aromas, fruity, citrus.
Klar lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Smak av grape, sitrus, humle og karamell. Lukt av grape, sitrus, humle og karamell. Melkebaren.
Frisk duft av citrus. Fin gyllen farge. Hvitt dekkende skum. Frisk smak av citrusfrukter med en sittende ettersmak.

On tap Mikkeller Sthlm. Ag golden beer with lasting white head. Aroma is sweet wit malt, grains and a bit of flowers. Same in the taste. Havn´t got that dry bitter bite that some german pilseners have.

On tap @ LExpress de Lyon (Mikkeller Tap Takeover). Clear golden with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is herbal/grassy with fruity hops and floral notes. Taste is moderately sweet, quite grassy and theres important fruity notes. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Good Pilsner though its a tad heavy for the style. Drinkable.
Clear copper, minimal white head. Fruity aroma. Fresh, hoppy, watery. Lovely grassy bitterness combined with good drinkability. Nice for a hot sunny day.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm as Vasa Pils, I believe its an alias. Clear straw yellow beer with white head leaving lacing. Aroma has tropical fruits, caramelly sweetness and some aromatic hops. Flavor is pale malty, fruity and bitter. Palate is almost medium full with quite heavy carbonation. Finishes with quite strong grapefruity bitterness and maltiness. A really good
lager, quite APA like, more a Premium Lager than a pils.

On tap at mikkeller viktoria. Golden with white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy with malty notes and some mild, faint dms. Taste is nicely balanced, pleasant, sweet with mild fruitiness. Long bitter finish. Earlier Rating: 4/12/2014 Total Score: 3On tap. Clear golden with white head. Aroma of malt,, flowers and sweet notes. Taste is malty, flowers, green notes, herbs and a low bitterness.

Draught @ Mikkeller. Slight hop aroma of American hops. Some DMS. Very smooth and fruity taste. Well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours a clear golden beer with a thin white head on top. Aroma is orange peel, pils malt, faint yeast. Flavor is medium bitter, loads of citrus and a grainy base. Very nice pils.
On tap at mikkeller bar. Aroma has malt and slight hop. Taste is balanced, a very nice pils.
Draft at Soljica Caffee Belgrade.Pour it yellow-orange colour.Taste and aroma of dry hops, fruits.Totally strange for pilsner.Interesting!

Draft at Soljica Cafe in Belgrade. The latest of their strange-but-great debuts of Mikkeller beers in Serbia. Bright, slightly hazed, rich gold. Creamy white head. Big fruity hop aroma, very surprising. Some malt but mostly citrus. Clean and refreshing, fruity body. Subtle lagering and malt-crispness. Very much over-hopped for style, an odd mashup, but results are very tasty.

On tap in Belgrade! It pours golden and clear orange color, clear with a minimal white foam which leaves a lacing. Stunning nose of hops, fresh grass harvest, spring flavor of fields, tropical fruits. So complex. In the mouth is refreshing, a bit sour, with a dry end. Good beer but let's call it an experimental pilsner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Ølhus Stockholm, Helsinki
Tikkeller-tick #150! - 
Pours golden orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of fruity hops, grass, bready malts and citrus. Taste is smooth, grassy and hoppy with loads of citrus, some crisp caramely notes and hints of butter. Finish is hoppy, bitter and fruity with some sweet caramel and grassy notes. Quite balanced and sessionable pils/APA hybrid for hopheads.

Tap (0lhus Stockholm, Helsinki)
Crappy lager aroma, plastic. Pale, brief head. Plasticky body, yucky crystal malts. Thin palate. Pretty crappy lager. No reason to drink this.
Tap at Ölhus Stockholm, Helsinki. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grain, some hops and malts. Pretty basic.
On tap at mikkeller bangkok. Refreshing after a long walk. Some citrus and grass, medium bitterness, medium sweetness.

Tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Pours a luminous gold, some frothy white bubbles, very pretty. Aroma is pleasant though more like a pils/APA hybrid: cantaloupe, strawberry, red licorice, earthy hops, toasted bread, flowers. Taste is also a hybrid: slight juicy hops with doughy and crackery malt, rosemary, nice mouth-drying bitterness that isnt over the top. Very strong offering and I understand why this was chosen as a house beer. Sessionable.

Keg at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, 02/03/14.
Clear orange with a moderate off white swirl.
Nose is is juicy hops, bitter orange, pine notes, lihgt mango, grassy.
Taste comprises mandarin, apricot, citric pithdom, juicy hoppage, light pine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp close with subtle hop bitterness.
Solid hoppy sessionable affair - premium lager ?! APA flavour wise.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Aroma: floral hops, some hay. Appearance: clear gold, small white head. 
Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters go to background, light sweetness comes up, average-long finish, dry and medium bitter at the end. Overall: nice Pilsener, fantastically complex palate. Pint at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.

On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. This was an absolute delight! Pale yellow pour, medium white head. Notes of grassy fields and a light spice hop. Flavor is light but full of grass, spice hop, and a beautiful bitter finish. Wish I could get 6ers of this in the States! A must try if you hit the BKK location.
@ Mikkeller & Friends. Nörrebro Pilsner. Trevlig pilsner, fruktig och humlig, bra beska.

Tap at the Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Poured a clear light amber with a thin white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is light hop. The flavour is medium bitter with a super hoppy crisp bitter citrus palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A really refreshing pils ... but more like an IPA. No complaints from me though!

Tap at mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Pours a gold colour with a white head. Funky, sweaty, fruity aroma. Light body, full carbonation. Orange, funky fruits, a touch of veg, tangerine and a touch of lemon. Mild bitterness. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Nørrebro brewery. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, malts, salted crackers and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, malts and hops. Very nice pilsner.

Draft at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade.
Hazy orange with a small head.
Sweet aroma with mango and peach.
Crisp fruity taste. Yep, its that crispy Mikkeller taste again. 
Light body, medium carbonation with a dry after taste.
Really refreshing, though too easy to drink but this is really good.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2016 Tap at before 9. Cloudy orange, low head. Stinky hops, puss, grapefruit, biscuit. Very hoppy, nice malt flavor, some Munich, very nice drinking beer and nothing like the first time I had it. 

Tap at Friends 9/2013: 6/3/5/2/10. Orange color, slightly cloudy, almost flat. Nose of oranges, honey. Falvor of sweet orange, biscuit, grass. Syrupy and ale-like. Ok, but not very impressive at all. Thick and oily, heavy, with a rather nasty finish
On tap. Clear pale golden with a fizzy white head. Skunky earthy grain and bread aroma and taste with a hoppy bitter finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF. A clear one, golden in color and with a small, white head. A peachy one, with a touch of citrus peel. Simple, but pleasant, although not very pilsner-like. The flavor has a nice bitterness, as well as peachy and pine hops and a little malty touch. Medium body, dry on the palate, soft carbonation. Bitter and dry finish. Not a very interesting one, but it slakes the thirst and is definitely not foul. 130805Earlier Rating: 8/5/2010 Total Score: 3.7On tap at Mikkeller. A slightly hazy, golden beer topped by a nice, white head leaving lacings. Citrusy, almost cat pee-like hops. Mostly citrus peel though. Grainy base with cat pee and resins up front, quite dry even though theres sweetness. Long, dry, grainy finish. Full body. Definately not the average pils. Rating: 7-3-7-4-14-3.5. 100506On tap at Mikkeller. It pours almost clear, golden in color and with a decent, off-white head that disappears a bit quick. Nice lacings make up for that. Citrus, tropical fruits and a little malty touch in the aroma, didnt feel as cat pee-like as the first night. The same goes for the flavor, where a good sweetness serves as a foundation for fruity hops with peaches and pineapple. The bitterness is present, but sort of drowns in the fruityness. Full-bodied, and dries up towards the end. Definately not pils in a regular way, tasteful and moreish. 100508

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, San Francisco, CA
Pours clear deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus and floral. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.Earlier Rating: 10/20/2011 Total Score: 3.6Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, København
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus and grape. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Stort glas från fat på Mikkeller i Kph. En riktigt bra pilsner, blivande favorit! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavor with lingering bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Honestly more of an IPA than a pilsner.

June 2011. On tap at Mikkellers bar in Copenhagen. Pours golden color with a white head. Lots of hops added to this one which gives it so much more character. In addition, hay, glass and malty notes. Good long finish. Definitely a winner.

Draught @ Mikkeller&Friends. Pours clear dark golden with partly lasting and good lacing frothy off-white head. Aroma is quite hoppy and malty with toasted malt, grapefruit, grass, citrus. Taste is light+ sweet and light+ bitter. Body is light+, texture is light creamy, carbonation is soft+. Finishes quite hoppy, bitter and dry.

Fra fat på Mikkeller&Friends (under navnet Nørrebro pilsner), mai-13: akk, om dette kunne være en standard og ikke et unntak innen genren! Mye aroma og smak, og godlydene sprer seg rundt bordet. Betryggende at M&F ligger i snubleavstand fra hytta.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, pours a hazy orange with a small off-white head. Aroma of dry grassy hops. Flavour of dry grassy hops, some herbal notes, and dry biscuity malts. Nice and dry, and highly drinkable. Very solid thirst quenching pils.

[Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends] lite citrus och.... skosula i aroman?!
Väldigt bra balanserad, lite kolsyra, citrus
Slightly cloudy gold pour with thin head. Aroma is mangos and stone fruit. Taste is malt with big tropical fruit flavour and some residual bitterness.

1 finger head. Fades fast. Burnt orange 
Grapes and honey with lemon and grassiness. 
Whoa. This is an amazing beer. Sweet, dry with grapes and honey. Sharp dry finish with floral notes
Best pils Ive ever had

Pours hazy amber with no head
Aromas are hoppy citrusy. Feel home brewed.
Medium bitter, low bodied, low sweet. Carbonated. Nice fresh taste.

Growler. Light hazy golden liquid with medium to big off-white head. Aroma of mango, tropical fruit, biscuit, bread and citrus. Very fresh and clean. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of mango and biscuit. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome stuff.

Draft at Mikkeller. Pours a slightly hazy dark gold with a dense and creamy off white head. Big explosive pineapple nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Toasty caramel crackeriness on the mid palate with great fruity hop presence and a long clean crisp finish. On paper, you would swear this is an IPA based on the way it drinks. Actually, the bartenders love to comment on many of the beers here that theyre so hoppy that they bleed into IPA territory--they serve a lot of pints (half liters, whatever, you know what I mean) with a nod, saying "for a ____, its a great IPA." God bless a heavy hop hand when its attached to a sound recipe mind.

([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ bar, DK)  Pours a pleasing gold in colour. Not a great fan of pilseners but this of course is no ordinary pilsener. Aroma/taste is very hoppy with great citrus flavours, and the pineapple is very prominent, also with other subtle nuances of light grainy malt, grass and pine on the palate. Very refreshing.

On tap at Beer Temple. Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma is floral, light zesty tropical hops, light malty. Flavour is mild, floral, smooth malts, light grainy, citrus, grassy hoppy finish. Light-bodied. Nice.

House beer at Mikkeller bar. Very good Pilsner. Nothing fancy, nothing extreme - just a simple, hoppy Pilsner. And I mean Mikkeller Hoppy, not Pilsner Urquell hoppy.
Highly drinkable.
Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Poured clear light copper in colour with a white head. Crisp on the nose, quite hoppy on the whole. Flavour is hay and some light grassy hops. Decent.

Pours an orange color with a white head. Citrus hops up front with a good floral note, some hints of pine, and a nice tropical fruit aroma. A bit of bread, but the hops really dominate. The flavor is mildly sweet and malty, but as with the nose, tons of hops. A lot of grapefruit, tropical fruit, pine, and a hint of grass. A light bitterness on the finish.
Great Pilsner. Lots of hops aroma, mostly american. Some bitterness, enough to make it nice to drink in the sun, and drinkable. Body is not bad as for the alcohol percentage
Canned pineapple on the nose and as well in the taste along with hops and spruce needles. Very nice Summer drink.

nose: pineapple hops, 
Taste: Acidy, hoppy, bitter 
aftertaste: bitter hops
body: light very hoppy
general: Nice refreshing hoppy beer, good at summer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
dark golden color. Oranges, apricots and pineapple in the mouth. Very hoppy, much more like a pale ale. Very enjoyable for what it is.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, June 2012.

Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste of hops, grass, caramel, citrus and some bread. A fresh and drinkable Pilsener, hoppier than the normal one.

Ganska humlerik doft. Ska det vara så i en pilsner? Smaken är frisk fruktig och med en del humlebeska. Smaken påminner lite om brew dog punk ipa. Helt ok men pils??

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ mikkeller bar. 
Pour slightly hazy crisp yellow, with a thin white ring as head. 
Aroma of slight pine, slight orange peel, caramel, slight bread(?), and some very faint hints of tropical fruits. 
Taste is a little bitter. 
Average body, with a semi-fizzy carbonation.

Draught @ The Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear golden with a small with head that leaves a small trace and tiny lacing while dissipating. Smell is sweet, hoppy, malty and slightly stale with caramel, bread, orange peal and hints of pine. Taste is malty sweet and rather bitter with caramel, orange peal, pine, and grass. Mouthfeel is rather watery and thin to medium bodied. finish is bitter with grass and citrus.
pale, clear, white foam, lightly bitter, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter,

From growler: Clear golden colored with a frothy white head. Light malty, fruity hoppy nose with notes of citrus, grain, bread and grass. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of citrus, grass, bread and pine needles leading to a dry hoppy-fresh finish. A thirst-quencher.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Poured golden color with a decent, lacing white head. Aroma is cat piss, hops and slight spiciness. Flavor is oranges and fruity hops. Crisp, refreshing brew,  maybe a bit thin body, nice bitter, lasting finish.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 16 Feb 2012) Golden colour with brief, white head. Malty, hoppy nose with citrus, grainy malt, white bread and grass. Hoppy, malty taste with notes of citrus, grass, white bread, hints of pine needles and grapefruit in a dry finish with lots of fresh hops. Medium body, quite dry. Very nice modern style lager.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, opening night, plastic cupHazy golden color; nice creamy head. The aroma is very fruity: passion fruit and grapefruit. Good dry toffee flavor, strong hopping, with dry resins and limited fruitiness. The final is very bitter, with a lot of hop oils, and no sweetness, maybe just too dry. I would say, a very good American Pale Ale.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. This one pours a near-clear copperish body with a small quickly sidesticking just off-white head. Lots of fruity aroma here. A pilsner you way? Tons of grapefruit, citrus and a nice hint of peachy fruits. The carbonation level is average and it has a mouthdrying oily texture. Grapy and quite hoppy-bitter this "pilsener". Mild malty with lots of almost grassy-bitter hops in the finish. A damn good thirst quencher no matter what the category should be. 06.01.2012

Det här kan vara världens bästa pilsner men endast för att den påminner mer om en ipa än en pilsner, bortsett från den tunna kroppen. Det blev lite av en märklig upplevelse, ungefär som att dricka rom när man förväntar sig whisky. Slutsats: god men märklig.

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Hazy golden body, small white head. Aroma is sweet floral hops, grass and pale malts with hints of peache. Very floral for a pilsener, but nice indeed. Taste is dry grassy hops, peaches, melon and pale malts. Very fresh on the palate and with a ridiculous drinkability, though a but too American in both aroma and taste to really classify as a pilsener - this is more reminiscent of a lager-ish APA than anything else.
Tap. Light golden with a small white head. Smell pine and yeast. Taste of pines, grape fruit, peach. A really good pilsner.

tap. clear golden, with a soft pillowy head, Aroma: grapefruit, light cats piss, gooseberries, peach, elderflower, pine, light grassy, floral, light farty, citrussy hops, light caramel, light malty, resin, Taste:  citrussy, very fruity, light caramel, fruity sweetness, floral, grapefruit, orange peel, lemon peel, peach, quite bitter, elderflower, dry, resin and pine, dry grapefruity aftertaste. NICE!! gå hjem og vug tyskland og tjekkiet!
At Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen New Year weekend 2010. Golden with a small head, A floral and fresh beer.

Beer No. 86 on my tour through Austria, Germany and Denmark.
On tap at Mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow/golden coloured, small white head, aromatic hoppy nose. Moderate malty, citrusy hoppy with strong lingering bitter finish and aftertaste. Very nice and refreshing.
On tap @ Mikkeller Bar. The aroma has grassy, citric hops. Clear, golden coloured beer with a white head. The taste is light bitter, bit floral and citric, bit malty. Dry and clean pilsener.
[10/2/11] Draught at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Clear deep golden. Aroma of tropical fruits hops. Flavor of tropical fruits hops. Medium-bodied.
From tap. Golden with some white head. Floral and citrus, hoppy. Finishes bitter. Impressed with the body, given its a pilsner.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Rated on 5.10.2011.
Pours a golden copper colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of strong floral hops and citrus. Flavour of strong floral hops, grapefruit, caramel malts, exotic fruits and some herbs. Medium boded, thick mouthfeel and a finish of crispy floral, bitter hops with some fruitiness. More of an APA I think, but still excellent.
Drought @ Mikkeller bar. Hazy orange pour, thin white head. Aroma of fresh floral hops, grapefruit and citrus. Flavor is bitter hops, very refreshing, quite fruity. Great session ale.

Tap. Gold with a white head. Aroma of citrus, passionfruit, gooseberries.. Taste has tropical fruits,  a little grain, pleasant but modest bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. Not much like a pilsener at all (its full of fruit), but a nice delicate beer thats very refreshing.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a clear golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty grainy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.

On tap at Beer Temple. Hazy golden body with thin head. Nose of hops and citrus. Really nice and sweet and hoppy flavour. Cant believe its a pilsener. Very refined and delectable. Bitter in the finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Refreshing US hopped lager, a bit lighter than the more common American dream
Draft @ Mikkeller Bar. Really fresh and drinkable. The typical american hops adds a modern feel to it.

Draft @ mikkeller bar. Aroma is fruity american hops, touch of blue cheese. Flavour is quite dry with a subtle bitterness, again fruity ameican hops dominate. More a pale ale then a pilsener, but definitely nice.
(draft on openningday 2010) great hopmixture, very well balanced and über fresh mouthfeel. Solid and fresh brew.
Yellow-colored lager with plenty of hop flavor. A very good beer with a very fresh taste.
Keg @ Craft Beer Co. Pours a cloudy amber, with a medium off white head. Grassy hop, toffee, orange rind, passionfruit, heavy bitterness on the finish. One hell of a pilsener!!!
On tap at Craft Beer Co. That is a hell of a lovely lager.  Lots of hops on finish.  Really hoppy as hell.  So drinkable.  Lovely

Smell: Apricot, Lychee, orange, some hay, toffe.
Taste: Orange peel, pineapple, grapefruit.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, refreshing bitterness, quite dry and crisp.
Notes: A nice treat for hophead who wants a session beer.

On tap. Pours Slightly hazy and deep golden with a creamy off-white head. Fair lacing . Nose of citrus and caramel notes. Light bodied. Medium carbonation. Medium sweet flavour with fruit, especially citrus and caramel notes. Watery texture. Ends up with a nice bitterness. Very nice for a pilsner type.
Draft. A golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of hops and grass. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, grass, and hops, leading to a bitter finish. Nice pils.
Dufter dejligt af blomster og humle.. flot mørk gylden med hvidt skum...smager dejligt af humle og blomster..... lækker krop! :) dejlig eftersmag..... i alt en dejlig pilsner..

Tap, Mikkeller bar. Three fingers of slightly off-white head; clearer orange-yellow hue.  Great lacing and head retention.  Definitely lots of hops for the aroma, more than expected, grapefruit, lemon, earth, and minerals.  Very savory hoppiness in the flavor with almost a saltiness.  Thinner body, but nice bubbly carbonation.  Could drink this all day.  Lovely.

Clear golden with a tall lasting head. Aroma is malty and rather hoppy - grapefruitt and grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Fermentation aside this isnt really a pilsener but more like an American pale ale. 021210

Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Heavy hoppy and moderate malty aroma. Grassy notes. Heavy bitter flowery flavor. Much more IPA-ish than pilsner. Long fantastic bitter finish. Creamy palate. Excellent beer, but it couldnt win a pilsener contest.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2014 Pours golden amber with a white head. On the nose I got hops, light pine, citrusy hops, grassy notes, weak straw and some malty notes. I got the same stuff in the taste along with some citrus, weak fresh spices, orange peel and an overall juicy feel to it. A nice fresh feeling overall. Best pilsner I have had!

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pale golden beer with a small white head. Hoppy metallic aroma, fruity, pine apple notes, some citrus. Hoppy citrus , metal, grass, pine apple notes. Metallic finish.
Tap @ MikkellerBar. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Flavour is malt, dry, fruit, pine and hops.

Draught at the bar. High creamy lasting white head. Hazy amber body. Barley malt aroma with hops pine and lemon. Mild barley malt pine lemon flavor with good deal of bitterness. High carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste.
Tap. Very nice hop aroma. Nice golden color with a white head. Very nice balanced body with a strong light dry bitter palate. Nice strong bitter and hop palate. Very nice
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Golden colour with white head. Aroma is hop, malt, grain. Flavour is hop, malt, fruit, citrus. Nice beer.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours out in a hazy dark golden colour with a small creamy white head. Dryish citric hop aroma with notes of white bread. Medium-bodied with dryish hop notes of lemon-zest, mild flowers and biscuits. Bitter finish of citric fruits.

On tap. Pours an almost clear dark golden with a creamy off-white head leaving laces. Intense citrus notes in the aroma. Light body with a lightly fruity sweetness and then again distinct citrusy hops leaving a solid bitterness. A typical Mikkeller creation - a Czech or German tourist however would probably suffer a stroke drinking this. 270810

26-AUG-2010, draft @Mikkeller on Brewdog night.
Golden disappearing head. Refreshing.
Some light malt like hay but m ostly hops, bitter and floral.
Lake a pale ale. Fine beer, perfect pilsner.
chiara bella schiuma buona persitenza naso luppolato intenso erbaceo in bocca malto iniziale poi amcora luppolatura piuttosto intensa finale piuttosto amaro

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Clear golden with some bubbles and a nice clean wfoamy white head. Aroma is very very floral with primary notes of elderflower but also fresh leaves and grass. Flavor is on the bitter side though not as bitter as an ipa. The taste is clean and fresh which supports the floral theme for this beer. The malt is in the background.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar) Poured deep golden and clear. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma was sweet and fruity. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter.

5th May 2010. Mikkeller Bar. Copenhagen. Free beer! No wonder its so damn crowded here! CVlear gold beer. Little head. Soft palate. Clean refreshing hops. Grpaefruit and little pine. Finishes smooth with a faint sweet note and then a bitter aftertaste. Wish all pilsners were like this!
On tap @ Mikkeller bar. Golden body with a diminishing white head. Very nice aroma of citrus fruit and hay. Flavor is refreshing and fruity, quite dry and a nice hoppy aftertaste. A nice pilsner.
extremely well-bodied for a regular pilsner. the ipa-label isnt very far off here. lots of fresh, sparkly hops both on the nose and taste-wise

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.  Hazy golden, small head. Aroma of peppermint and black currant. Dryish at first, some sweet wort comes through later. Fruity with plenty of black currant and some Belgian style marzipan-like yeast character. Marked late bitterness.
Tap At Mikkler bar.Hazy golden colour with white head.Aroma of hops and corn,fresh crispy with flavor of citrus and wheat,good malty and flowery well balance and hoppy finish.

On Tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 08/05/2010
Hoppy aroma. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with an orange flavour. A hint of dryness in a lasting finish.

Small white head. Deep yellow body. Strong floral resiny aroma with hoppy peppery oily notes. Dry resiny spicy grassy taste with herbal minty notes. Light body. Sharpish mouthfeel. Dry resiny minty aftertaste with pine needle notes. Absolutely outstanding! Drinkable, incredibly fresh, and full of character. Almost clinically clean. (0.25l draft at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.)

A Sim rate (on tap @ Mikkeller bar): Such sweet fresh hops. Citrus & a nice wheaty aroma. Great caramel colour & good head & lace. Its the hops that tingles the palate..almost brings tears to your eyes. Fresh, sweet & just slightly bitter.

On tap @ the opening of the Mikkeller bar. Pours deep golden, light hazy body, with a small white head.  Fresh floral aroma with peaches and pineapples, fruity flowery aroma, very nice. Good mouthfeel. Fresh hoppy taste, fruity, some ripe fruit, pleasant bitterness. A really good surprise this one

Tasted 2010-05-20. From tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours yellow with white head. Hoppy aroma. Slightly citric taste. Very hoppy flavour in a grassy way. Moderately bitter. Very refreshing. Not too heavy.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours clear dark golden with a small creamy head and lacings. Nose is hoppy. Grass and peach. Very dry and crisp citrussy hop flavor. I sense som "erotic" hops. Blueberry. Nelson Sauvin? Medium bodied Very good Pils!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar. Golden colour, mediumsized white creamy head. Aroma is very much Nelson Sauvinish. Flavour is fruity, bittery and some slightly earthy notes. Refreshing and lovely.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Clear golden color, white foamy head. Aroma is lovely fresh fruity and citric hops. Flavor is crisp, halfdry with fine bitternes. Good carbonation, medium body. Long aftertaste of fruity hops. Lovely pilsner.

Draught at the opening of the Mikkeller bar. Bit unclear nice golden colour. Fresh Almost clear golden-amber body. Decent white head. Fresh floral aroma with peaches and pihoppy fruity flower aroma, very nice. Good mouthfeel. Fresh hoppy flavour, fruity, some ripe fruit, pleasant bitterness. A really tasty pilsner indeed!
Tap. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, flowers, hops and malt. Nice bitter finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, moderate to heavy hoppy, flowers, citrus, orange, grass. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, hoppy and dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Very nice session beer. [20100505]
Clear golden with white head leaving excellent lacing. Fresh orange and citrus zest. Medium bodied and bitter taste. Long finish. A summer delight!

Fair amount of free beer served in a plastic glass during the reception on the opening day of the Mikkeller bar in Viktoriagade. Almost clear golden-amber body. Decent white head. Fresh floral aroma with peaches and pineapples. Fine blended taste with bittersweet nuances of hoppy fruits. Semi-sharp, dry bitterness to the finish. Delicious pilsner with eminent drinkability (Copenhagen, 05.05.2010).

No need to go to Prague any longer.
On tap at the Mikkeller bar. Crisp, dry, hoppy, palate cleansing. Pine, grass, fantastic dryness. The finish lasts hele vejen hjem...

Body is clear, deep gold colored, with a white foamy head on top.  Fresh fruity hops on the nose, mellow citrus, tropical, grass and some light resinous notes. Taste is fairly  dry and crisp, with a restrained malt body. Bold fruity and grassy hop bitterness. Well-bodied. Sparkling mouthfeel.  Lasting hoppy and fruity ending. Quenching with super drinking abilities.

From tap at the bar. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Sweet fruity impression. Bone dry and crisp bitter flavoured into a dry and lasting fruity finish. Dry and crisp peachy lasting impression.
Draught at Mikkeller bar, Copenhagen, on May 8, 2010Clear golden color, white head. Hoppy citrus scent. Hoppy and sweet taste. Bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2010 Tab @ Mikkeller opening. light amber/yellow pour with a dense white head. The aroma is lager-yeasty but with a great hop addition. The hops are very smooth and nice in the aroma. The taste is very hoppy, a bit of pine, some pineapple, lemon and lime. Malt to back it up. Very good for a pilsner, but a lot like a light IPA, just bottom fermented. Light body, medium to high carbonation, medium hoppy duration. A really good pilsner, hoppy and very drinkable

Fad: Flot orange klar øl med et fint skumhoved. Super duft af humle. Citrus primært. Meget bitter mundfylde som trækker en lille anelse ned da det gør drikbarheden den smule mindre. Men stadig en superlækker øl.

free tap at mikkeller bar opening
clear orange, smooth white head.
flowery hoppy aroma, sweet flowery, sweet malty, hoppy.
nice very hoppy pilsener. lots of flavor and body for a 5% brew.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Grand Opening. This beer is supposed to be one of two steady taps at Mikkeller Bar. Being a pilsener I had my doubts whether this would be anything above average. It was.
This pilsener probably has more bitterness and hopflavor than 75% off the IPAs on the danish market.
Pours clear with a nice head. Fresh grassy, citrusy nose. A lot of sweetness (FG ~ 18) well balanced with the bitterness. Clean taste a very refreshing experience. Love it.

Clear dark golden beer with a big and lasting white head. Clean and fruity Nelson Sauvin aroma. Dry and fruity flavour with a nice touch of malt and a good bitter finish. Excellent session beer, just dont expect a classic pilsner

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar.
Pours clear golden with a small, creamy, light off-white head. Aroma is really pleasant hoppy. Fruity, plant sap, grass, apricot and piney. Medium carbonation, lovely dry mouthfeel. Flavour is equally lovely, piney, apricot, resiny and plant sap. Some oranges and really very bitter. Damn tasty, though it really has nothing to do with a regular pilsner - re-definition of a style :o)

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Clear amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of grass, hay, citrus and hops.
Fruity flavour of hay, citrus, hops and grass.
Hoppy finish.

Draught at Mikkeller-bar.
Clear Golden - White head. 
Lively hoppy, caramel, grassy, Nice light hoppy, citrus, Nice bitterness.

Hoppy! Bitter, floral nose. Not much malt or alcohol. Fresh as pilsener, average as IPA.

 Looking forward to drinking regularly though.

 Tap at Mikkeller Ølbar.
Clear golden with a medium white head. Hoppy aroma with grapefruits, pine and hints malt. Flavour was quite hoppy with grapefruits, pine and hints malt. Finished dry and bitter.
Tap at Mikkeller Bar. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Fruity hoppy aroma with notes of pine and caramel. Very fresh. The flavour is peach, caramel, hops and pine. Clean and fresh.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 Tap @ mikkeller ølbar. Clear orange body with a small head. Aroma is lors of hops, fruit. Flavor is fresh hops, fruit, notes of caramel. Very drinkable pilsner. Great
